review: Compared to other mobile games, this one is truly a gem. It's got great gameplay and aesthetics and just works so well. Unlike other apps, this doesn't have ANY intrusive advertisements. There are only optional ads every boss if you want to double your rewards (which I choose to watch everytime). The progression in the game is just right, unlocking harder modes as you go as well as cards and effects to balance it out. Each playthrough gives about 30 mins of gameplay. Great game!

review: Witch is the weakest class due to the game leaning toward multiple small amounts of damage instead of one or 2 big hits. Small hits are countered by "take X less damage" but this can be countered by just buffing each small hit. Heavy hits are countered by "only take 3 damage maximum per hit" which has absolutely no counters.

review: This is undoubtedly the best game in the app store. Reminiscent of Slay The Spire but different enough to stand right alongside it as the best in the genre. Not quite as challenging as StS, but more accessible with leagues better graphics and overall aesthetic. Do yourself a favor and buy everything available. It's fairly cheap and every piece of DLC adds more layers to it's infinite replayability. Support these guys so we keep getting more!

review: I have no problem with the concept of the game. I think it's unique and quite enjoyable. However it is possible to run into problems with purchases and the customer support for it is really really bad. They want you to join a group which has a Chinese name and description with a Chinese app and to join the group you have to answer a question but the question is in Chinese and it was hard enough to use google image translate to recognize the text on it and on top that when I finally understood what it said on the description of the group I learned that the "support hours are between 10 to 18 o'clock" are not helpful one bit because it is not said whether it is in Chinese time zone or not. Seriously this game has over 100,000 downloads and the devs don't even have a support channel for non Chinese people. Edit: Turns out you have to click on the purchase button once more for the game to register that you've bought it. Just spent 45 mins trying to get to the support for a fix for something so simple that I had no idea to fix. The support needs to improve a lot.

You can support developers buy purchasing new content and it is first mobile game where I did so. I do suggest it!

review: Honestly great game overall. You only get once class unless you pay, but once you get a hang if it you can beat the entire game with it. The games gets more and more complex as you advance and play the story again and again with multiple bosses, enemies, and choice aspects which require some thought and planning. You have to be able to build a streamlined deck and have synergy between your cards while working around the page limits per chapter. There is some grind, but its not bad and the game can get very spammy. Really fun game you can spend a few minutes or hours playing. Would recomend.

review: Good game. Still has glitches after beta. You cannot have more than a specific number of cards in your hand at the end of your turn. The game forces you to discard all remaining cards until you reach the maximum allowed at the end of the turn. There are deck and card options that will cause duplicate or extra cards to generate on an attack or action. This causes a bug during the discard period. The game will only allow you to select two cards to discard, preventing end of turn.

review: Beautifully designed but lacking in depth. It's way too easy even on hardest difficulties. The playthroughs started feeling same after three or four runs. There isn't enough variety in how your journey looks like even when you pick a different class. Each time I go through the same exact motions. There isn't a depth of meaningful unlocks outside the runs. I unlocked all "stardust" bonuses right away, and new blessings for completing a run are not exciting, most of them are weak and don't change much. It would really help to be able to travel to different locations, besides Forest and Graveyard, to make runs feel more varied. Unique side quests, hidden bosses, puzzles or an option to risk the entire run just to unlock some strong cards would make it more interesting. The Castle DLC also has only one path and little variety. Why not give us a choice of visiting different parts of the castle.

My only complaint is that when a Taod prophet spawns, it has a chance to not only kill you in 3 turns but has Holy Immunity forever enabled on it. You cannot kill it and it really stops a good run. Only reason I'm not 5 stars is that, otherwise this game is way to good not to play.

review: Great game. The best Game I´ve ever tried on mobile. Good gameplay and I really like the artwork and the cut-scenes which led me to a few notes. I wished there was a gallery section, could be placed somewhere in the Achievement section, where you could re-watch the prologue, epilogue and whatnot. During cut scenes, where several pages are used, like the start of the "Diaries Adventure", it just cut to the next page on it´s own. I would prefer the option to move on to the next page at my own leisure as to take in the artwork/story better. There are some flaws in the english translation, and when you fight "Little Red" she speaks Chinese at the end of the battle, even though it has been set to english. These flaws do not ruin the experience, but it would be an improvement to have them fixed. I hope that this game gets more publicity and support, so that more updates and expansions will arrive, and the story can continue. I also like the puzzle section, please add more. .

review: I gave it a 5 star. Very interesting gameplay. Graphics are impressive. It's really fun to explore the different options and discover every "class". My problem is with the final corrupt boss. It is so hard... Like not even closely related to anything else in the game. It's not just challenging, it feel cheated. To the point I now avoid this path knowing it will ruin my fun. Please investigate balancing. Challenge vs reward. A challenge is always welcome. This is not a challenge...

review: Simply one of my favorite mobile games ever. Not that its mobile only, its also on Steam. But if you enjoy any TCGs or CCGs, you should love this. It offers a surprising number of viable archetypes for building decks into, an active community and a chatty development team. It is slightly narrative driven and certainly not as complex as OG card games like Magic but nothing is. Think more like a moderate to occasionally hard difficuly CCG with many classes or archetypes to tinker with.

review: Honestly, I loved this game. I got to the Witch (one of three mega bosses) and was fine. The comabt was challenging, but I eventually emerged victorious. Now, let's talk about the Werewolf (one of the other mega bosses). Well, let's just say every turn he regens 20% of his max health, has an item that allows him to survive lethal damage oh, and he will constantly make you choose from a list of effects, one of which is to make him automatically regen 40% of his max health. Why would you pick that, you ask? Because after awhile is the only option let to you. And after reaching level ten with cards that are seriously on point (a revival effect too I might add) THREE TIMES and getting my butt slowly worn down THREE TIMES over the span of 30 MINUTES and not being able to do anything because my deck is literally 60% prank cards, I'm deleting this game. I can't get to the endgame because of the Werewolf, no matter how good my cards are or how many passives I have, so there's no point to keeping it, which is really a shame because it was a lot of fun up until then.

Sometimes it'll let you almost kill it, then you die again. I'm over it.

review: Night of the Full Moon is a passion project, and you can tell. So much effort has been put into the writing, art, and animation that it's criminal to not pick this app up. Ads aren't intrusive, and are purely optional. The multiple DLCs are actually priced fairly for once, and feel like they add something new to the game. To top it all off, this game is seriously so much fun to play! The only complaint I have would be that the RNG on the perks you get can be unfair at times, but that's it!

review: Pretty great game. Intuitive, fun, and engrossing. My only real complaint is that the Headless Horseman's buff that stacks piercing damage to the player at the start of each turn is MASSIVELY over powered. Normal damage would be fine but 20+ piercing damage to eat at the start of each turn while the Horseman gets 2 resurrections per battle as well? Come on.
star: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

review: This game is fantastic! The art is great, the setting and story is wonderful, and the whole experience of adventure really sets this game apart. The first time I have ever paid for in-game content in a mobile game. This new genre of build-as-you-play deck games really brings a lot of re-playability to an otherwise stale CCG market. The rouge-like-ish style allows for players to try new tactics and explore different play styles without having to invest in dozens of random card purchases. Play this game. Then buy the in-game content to add new characters and stories. It is worth the $6.00!

I recommend you play it once, beat it and then uninstall because the other classes arent worth the "value" they sell it at.

review: This is a deck building adventure game in the style of Slay the Spire, and in my opinion, it actually does it better. Quirky and enjoyable writing, great art, and wonderful overall design. Most importanlty, the monetizasion and ads are done in the best way possible. You can have a great time without ever paying a cent or seeing a single ad, but you can unlock worthwhile content if you do. For me, this is the gold standard of freemium phone games. Well worth playing, and well done to the devs.

review: Overall love the game, bought the full version (something I very rarely do with mobile games). Every class plays differently, and as a card game player in general this aspect keeps me coming back. However... I cannot say this game is perfect. Considering I paid for the full version, having ads in there even as a way to revive or get more gold takes me right out of the game. Worse, if I do take advantage of it I feel like I cheated. While I can understand having ads for people who haven't paid a cent (you worked hard, you deserve to get paid), those who actually shell out the money for everything in the game (people like me) frankly shouldn't have to so much as see the word ad.

I'd still like to see some more healing options, now I'm stuck at the level 10 bear with only 14 health. I don't mind a challenge, but there's no hope for progress, and deters me from wanting to press on anymore. I think it's s great concept. Gameplay is interesting and challenging. A few grammar and spelling issues. Need a few more healing options, or healing over time, though. I'm pretty much stuck at a point with no life and the only options are enemies I can't beat with my remaining life. Keep improving and I'll probably come back!

My only issue is probably translation related on some cards and when i click the event notifications it leads me to the website in chinese with no translation. Card example: Storm Strike "you deal 1 additional damage this turn." What this actually means is "every time you damage the enemy, deal an additional damage this turn" so it stacks throughout the turn. Theres probably dozens of cards like this. I would give 5/5 if theyre fixed.

review: I'm not typically a mobile game addict, but I absolutely love this game. It nails the deck building that I enjoy about games like Clank! and Slay the Spire, but on-the-go. You can play through the entire campaign multiple times for free, or pay $5 for the entire collection in-app. Absolutely a steal for how much enjoyment I've gotten.

review: One of the greatest mobile games I've ever played. NO MICROTRANSACTIONS!! You can play the first story all the way through as much as you want for FREE. You earn gold (and can't buy it!) with skill and good choices to buy better cards. You do get double gold for watching, like, a literal 10 second ad, but there are no intrusive, mandatory ads. I'm GLAD to watch the ad.  No pay-to-win. Once I beat all the bosses in that story, the "in-app purchases" are buying more characters and stories with totally different cards, rewards, and strategies. And there's 8 difficulty levels for each character.   I wish more games were like this where you choose to buy content instead of advantages.

review: Just brilliant I have always loved playing card games like Hearthstone or Clash Royale, but one of the most annoying and off-putting about them is their mechanic. They will feel very rewarding and pleasing at first but after you climb higher in the ranking ladder, everything seems to focus on who have a better deck of cards. This game solved that problem by removing the PvP aspect. So if you are looking for a great card game to play without worrying too much, this is a perfect fit for you.

review: This is an honest review from a player that loves dungeon like games since they became a fashion. This game is a gem I played a LOT for 2-3 days and I bought ALL the classes (6 euro).So for a free to play player that has only 1 class does it get bored? The answer is it depends if you are playing for 30 minutes a day no it won't because every time you restart the game you can follow a different path to build your deck. The replay ability of this game is awesome. With only the knight class I tried several decks (full damage,always picking the action cards etc.). If you want/can spend 1,20 euro and buy a second class recommending the dark mage or the magician you instantly unlock a new play style with new several ways to build your deck. In conclusion the game is a gem worth the 6 euro, worth the 5 star review, very nice graphics, very nice music. I don't want to write a very long review so the best you can do is download it and check it for your self :D

review: Honestly, it's a great tcg. Great story, so many paths to branch off into, and a steady difficulty curve. The game IS short and the pay wall exists with little different to offer between the different classes but I don't mind too much. Ther's still enough there to change your playstyle to make the game feel different enough to add to replay value. The completionist in me loves all the cards (and there are a ton), achievements, and the skill tree. The casual gamer in me loves that I can just pick the game up or put it down whenever. It's a great download and I'm sure I'll be busy with it for a while.

The werewolf just keeps getting health back and drawing extra cards while I just keep getting cheated. I'll be uninstalling within the hour if I don't hear back on how to increase my odds of winning without starting over. I'm not fighting the same enemies again. Edit 3 minutes later: I'm too annoyed, I'm just going to uninstall the game.
star: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

review: Absolutely restored my faith in app gaming. Cute, immersive, intuitive. I love it, my daughters love it (we even use it as a sort of bedtime story). They don't even ask for money or force ads down your neck. I almost rang support to beg them to please take some money but don't worry! you can pay princely sum of 99p to play higher difficultly mode! Perfection. All other p2p faux f2p micro transaction rubbish should be ashamed.
star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

review: I would like to see more options and longer chapters to make a better deck (5 instead of 3 chapters). More personalized achievements instead of the generic ones. My biggest complaint is the extreme difficulty jump from normal to hard. Normal is "easy" while hard is "very difficult". Deck building is the fun part of the game. Don't make it harder to build a deck (higher costs, less gold, etc), just make the enemies tougher.
star: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

review: Fantastic game. Downloaded it expecting freemium and got literal hours of quality content with the only catch being an offer every 30 minutes or so to watch an ad to give you more in-game currency. We should read developers who stand behind the quantity of their games and don't use them as cheap cash grabs. If you like deck builders, give this game a chance. You won't be disappointed.

Still worth a play.

review: Fantastic game. Been playing for about 11 hours now. My only big complaint is whenever you die, I would prefer prefer the run to be over. Feels like I'm not accomplishing as much if dying is virtually meaningless. Besides that, the playing style and deck building are fantastic. Lots of variety within each one of the classes. I've built a completely different deck each time and have found many successful and fun builds. Love the game both story and gameplay wise. Thank you devs 😊

review: This game is fantastic! First of all, it is not a simple pay to play game, which is hard to find. Wish I could say more! ❤

The game is not balanced incredibly well there are alot of enemys who can be very strong. The dullahan is my least favorite enemy in the game. Thankfully you have infinite tries, so you end up winning.

review: NotFM is one of the best put-together mobile games I've played. Its a roguelike deckbuilder (similar to Slay the Spire) with incredible sound design, a wealth of strategies and play-styles to explore, and an evolving story that develops as you progress. review: Devs, I can't get the 'sum of side-effects is 999' achievement. It's bugged and I put a good amount of time into setting up my deck to get it. Please fix it and, if you can, give me my achievement. Really well-designed cardgame when you get to the bottom of it. A lot of clever choices, divergent from most other card games, such as giving you control over what is in your deck by withholding certain cards (your deck reshuffles every turn, not just when it runs out) and enabling you to setup more powerful turns and combos. The card design is generally really good, encouraging synergistic and efficient decks with ludicrous combo potential. Currently it's held-back by: - Incorrect tooltips that are either poor English translations or do not correctly capture their effects (e.g. Headless Horseman will reflect sub-lethal AND lethal damage). - Poor or broken English lines read by the great voice actors they got, which seems like a shame. - Small bugs and strange interactions, usually involving doing things too fast. - JiuJitsu. I hate this card so much. If you play this game you will to. Luckily it's rarely used but it falls into a small family of extremely uninteractive cards present within the game.

review: I never leave reviews on games and apps, but this game is soo good that i feel compelled to. Not only is it a very well-developed card game with fun mechanics and interactions, but it is all entirely contained within the OFFLINE game; all cards are available through the game, and there is no trading and purchasing cards required. It has really high replayability within the first free class, like, hours of gameplay. I purchased the expansion and i am really excited to play it. Highly recommend.

review: I'm a big fan of this game, it's great. It's very repayable, great mechanics, astounding art and atmosphere. The only thing I'm not a fan of is the limitations on classes. Now I know everyone needs to make money and I'll spend money on a game I like, but to limit the experience to just the warrior is very detrimental to the player. You don't have to give every class, but something more then just the warrior would be great. Give the player a way to unlock another class like ranger or mage.

review: Love the game love everything about it! It feels slightly like the binding of isaac without being a clone or rip-off. The combos you can make are extremely satisfying, the sound track isn't annoying (I find that most mobile games very repetitive). I love that the characters talk. The artwork is charming. And most importantly, It's hard without being unfair. You sir have made a top tier game! My only issues are, the card descriptions aren't always clear. I still dont know what equipment slots do. (I beat ever boss on normal.) And I want more content! MORE, maybe a Cinderella story or anything from a brothers grim novel. ANYTHING! I will be looking for more games like yours. You may have even set a new standard in my reviews. Keep up the amazing work my dude.

review: Gameplay and story development are brilliant. The fact that every adventure develops a different deck, hence different gameplay is challenging and fun. However I only rate it 4 stars for two reasons: 1. Why bother to make 4 classes buyable for a buck each? You either love it and buy the game or you don't. And there should be a short description for what you get when buying the "full version". 2. The game is just burning through the battery! Please take some time to optimize the consumption or implement a battery save mode. After playing for 20 minutes my cell is burning hot! Other than that I just wished for less Google translate texts surrounding the game. But at least in-game everything seems properly translated. Well done.

review: Favorite game on the phone. I've been playing it for about a week now whenever I get bored and it makes time fly.for the people complaining it's too hard/you need more healing options, you get plenty of healing, using it correctly is up to you. And for the difficulty, if you build your decks correctly you can be so ridiculously overpowered to the point that you'll take no damage from end game bosses and kill them in 2-3 turns. There's definitely a learning curve, but the game is very well made and a great time killer.

review: This is what a mobile game should be!!!  Awesome game with random events and forked endings. Tons of content, especially after purchasing additional characters which costs a very reasonable price for a mobile game.  Few suggestions for devs: 1. Remove the ad for resurrection which grants a free blessing this breaks the immersion of a very immersive game. Make the blessings a baseline because sometimes i die on purpose just to get those blessings. 2. Remove the ad for getting double reward from a boss kill. 3. To compensate on the removed ads introduce some random ads every X encounters. 4. Add option for In-App purchase to avoid ads but still enjoy their in-game benefits. 5. A cool feature would be a Nightmare mode where you have to complete the game in one sitting without dying. Leaving the game mid-fight or dying would wipe the current progress.   One of the best games i've ever played on my phone, keep up the good work!!!

review: A beautiful game with a clean and intuitive interface. The story is compelling and paced in such a way throughout the gameplay that it feels like a reward for a fight well done and not arbitrary filler you simply want to skip. The game allows a good amount of freedom, making strategy tailored to your decision-making instead of an o.p. one size fits all approach. The prices for further content are more than reasonable and in-game achievements are icing on the cake!

review: I absolutely love this game. When you first play the first character (the knight) is free to use and okay through as many times as you'd like. I did buy every character for this game. And I've yet to be bored of it and I've done a run through of every character at least once if not more. It's hours and hours of constant play even for a game you intentionally need to play multiple times over. And I enjoy the challenge to unlock all the achievements in the game as well. Would consider to anyone who wants a fun game you can spend hours on and enjoy a simple yet strategic card game with great art style.
star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

review: Loved the game up until the end of Chapter III, the first "Investigation". The first true boss is impossible to defeat if you haven't fought enough battles and earned enough to power your deck up. The delta in difficulty between this character and the previous foes is EXPONENTIALLY higher. And it's a very time consuming battle that can't be won if your cards can't do enough damage in a certain amount of card draws. It's a mathematical impossibility. That in itself is no biggie. IF you had the chance to go back, fight some more battles and upgrade or make changes to your deck. But this is where the game is BROKEN. You cannot go back and do anything. You can only read defeat screen after defeat screen reminding you of the obvious, "Your deck needs to be streamlined". Thank you captain obvious! Fix this and it's a 5 of 5 easy. But right now... if you value your time. Don't bother.

review: Simply put, this game is fun, but it lacks the replay value the description leads you to think it'd have. You only get one class to start with, and while the rest are cheap, it's even cheaper that you get locked out of 7/8ths of the game if you don't pay up, even more so if you go past just the classes. Knight is fun, but exclusively knight isn't. Giving everyone just one extra class to start would make this game so much better. But unless they do something like that, I won't be playing much.

review: Night of the Full Moon is a great game for anyone who wants to play a single player card game with good encounters. The ads in the game are also not in your face and completely optional to watch as well as the dlc for the game. Great game overall in my opinion.

review: This is honestly the best game I have ever played on a cellphone. Not only is it really entertaining, immersive and enganging, but it also has a beautiful story which basically is a"twist" (more of an extension) on the red riding hood story. I can't write a review on this without also mentioning the wonderful graphic design, music and just sound effects in general which together make an atmosphere that I haven't seen the likes of in a game before. It must have taken a lot of effort to make this and I really do not understand how this game not only is free, but also has NO ads... Actually zero. I was looking for an expansion pack and found something about a DLC and it said I had to log on, but when I did it disappeared. I need to support the creators in some way, please tell me what happened. I will now look for more info on this game and maybe there is a community somewhere, I just love it so much.

review: great game! gameplay is complex and the different classes actually play very differently. sometimes effect descriptions are unclear or flat out wrong, but it's not that hard to figure out the actual behavior. one issue in the newish 'diary' mode: even with all sfx and music muted, dialog is still played, but somehow weirdly distorted. without that bug it would be a 5 star game for me.

review: There is so much about this game that I can't explain in just plain words. Believe me, it's good, I did not expect it from a game like this. I hate and love everything this game provides, I don't know how to properly explain it, there is just so much content within this one free version and the story and combat and characters feel like there's something so special about each and every one of them. I then realize this game is only free to play now and have to pay for more content which I think is a good love by the developers. In my honest opinion I think this game would be worth buying if there was an option for multiplayer and I would most likely spend every dime I can on all the different playstyles if I see this. Sorry for the mixed review, I just don't know how to feel, keep up the "good" work. PS I tend to have a reputation of "killing" games when the developers take my opinion so take caution and godspeed.

It's clear from the change logs that they have had to nerf other stuff, the Witch needs nerfing.

review: One of the only reason this game is not getting 5 stars is due to frequent spelling errors. Other than that, this game is rather enjoyable and hard to put down. Sometimes, the enemy cards go by too fast, or the combos I count on go buggy or are unclear, but the system is relatively forgiving, and it's no reason not to play at least the free parts. If I had the money to spare, I would be unlocking all of Riding Hood's classes and playing through them, let me tell you.

review: Okay, so this is a build as you go deck builder roguelite, right? Well, kinda. Much like another game I love, Slay the Spire, you build up your deck from the basic beginner cards that each class has into a synergistic monster of whatever direction you take it. Beyond that, it has a great aesthetic, both music and design wise, as well as some simply very good voice acting work done. I genuinely reccomend throwing the devs some love by buying the in app stuff. It's just such a fun game.

review: Mobile games get heavily stigmatized due to the plethora of similar gameplay and aggressive microtransactions. However, I'm pleased to say that this game breaks the mold in this market. The artwork is stylized, gameplay is simple at face value and grows more complex overtime, and the game has so much replay value large in part by the amount of cards and classes in the game. This is one of the very few mobile games I was more than happy to support by buying all the (generously priced) DLC.

star: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

review: Edit: After following the kind advice from the developer to conserve heals and making a more balanced deck, I finally beat the boss in the lady knight class. Definitely enjoyed the gameplay more this time around & will be thinking about buying the other classes. Previous review: I was having fun until I had to keep fighting enemies with low health near the end of chapter three while playing the free lady knight class. I started a new adventure several times trying to get past this point, but found it impossible without more opportunities to heal between harder battles. On my last attempt before I deleted the app, I beat the demon king at the cost of a lot of HP, & couldn't defeat the other enemies I was expected to fight afterwards. It's a shame, b/c I would've loved to buy the other classes if the game hadn't become so frustrating. The graphics, voice acting, & different cards are really great. I just want more full heals between battles.

res:
Giant NetworkNovember 5, 2018Hi did you pass the final boss?
I can give you some tips about saving HP and you can try it again
1. Save fountain until your HP is at a very low value or before boss

While if you passed the game, please come back and leave a 5-star to us.
More tips you can find on our Facebook.

review: The game is very simple yet entertaining, art style quite suits the game, and prob even weaker phones are capable of running it. Cards are interesting, and player is able to combo cards in order to maximise their effectiveness (in some cases damage output is a bit too high in my opinion). However my rating is severely lowered because of the limit of the content because of purchasable characters. Far as I know, it used to be way more fun and way more entertaining because of more playable (free) classes. What I'd suggest is to leave (as it is) one class available and allow player to unlock two other through achievements or simply completing the game, and leave rest purchasable.

star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

review: A very good card game. I've never played something that had all the elements of being interesting, novel and also sleek. The game is not a huge battery drainer but has the perfect amount of beautiful art and animation to make it addicting. I picked it up and spent three hours on it immediately. I don't think the new content of the other classes is worth paying for, though, maybe if new characters and especially new plots and bosses were added as well. Ads at the end of a fight or chapter could be a way to make money. I found the gameplay slightly unbalanced in that some play styles were super overpowered (tomahawk + poison/lightning spam) while some made it difficult to defeat bosses. It didn't take away from my enjoyment of the game, though! To anyone considering it, give it a try.

Great work and I'll be happy to keep playing this game.

I like my old school game consoles (Nintendo's, Sega, etc) and only a couple "newer" games (W.O.W., Skyrim, The Sims). HOWEVER, THIS GAME WON ME OVER IMMEDIATELY! I love how you are able to choose different "storylines"/ "paths"/ "interactions" (...whatever you want to call it. Lol). It reminds me of those 'Choose your own adventure' books ...they were they only books I was willing to read. 😂

review: This game is amazing and addictive. The game play is interesting, exploring and setting up combos are very satisfying. Some classes are OP when you set up the correct combo. Also, every class play differently, and each class have several viable paths you can build into. The theme is strong, stories about the monsters and the world setting is immersive. One complaint is there are a few cards that seem to have their description a bit different from how it works, or its not well explained.

review: A simple card game with the ability to be more in depth as you raise the difficulty. This game kept me hooked for hours whenever I could play it. The replayability is insane since; your deck has a default set every time you start a new adventure. Depending on which character you pick; every cards you find will revolve around your character's deck. Also, this game can be played offline. (Worth the money to get all the characters)

review: Mechanics, art and sound are some of the best I've ever seen in a mobile game. It has downsides tho. Microtransactions poison it, all the other classes are paywalled and after finishing the game (all bosses both diff) it gets fairly boring. Sometimes the translations aren't on point and leave cards with ambiguous meanings. All in all, I recommend this game if you either got the $10 to buy everything (it's even cheaper). I loved this game and you'll love it too, even though it has some problems

review: Very fun game, but the balance with some bosses are way off. The Werewolf and Priest in particular need to be adjusted so that they're not impossible to beat. if you're unlucky enough to draw the Werewolf as a boss in any of the hard settings, good luck. His regen ability, immunity for 1 turn, plus defense against 1 attack over 8 damage each turn, PLUS negative card effects each turn AND over 200 hp makes it nearly impossible for a wee mana user at even Hard Level 2.

review: SPOILER ALERT: The graphics, controls, and gameplay were great, but the ending of the storyline butchered it. It was an ultimate betrayal. I cannot fathom this sick and demented fascination with eradicating beauty and justice. What is the point in fighting the dark and wicked if you're just going to marry off and procreate with it? All that hard work for nothing. All this game had to do was end differently (destroy the evil?) and it could have earned a 5-star review.

review: Really fun, but not all gameplay features are explained, like what "exile" means. I can't login via Google, so I can't access other classes, which means I can't access most of the game's content. The game doesn't seem to save often enough. When I return from a break, there are some things I had already done which are no longer done, such as using the free card upgrade ability, or buying things from the shops. I have to redo these things when I get back into the game.

review: I know how to beat the Werewolf on Hard, but the point is that the Werewolf is an unfair battle. The auto-heal is excessive and dreadful. I had a much more difficult time fighting the Werewolf than I did the Priest. But playing as a Nun, I could beat them through my own foresight. Unfortunately, the Ranger is a fundamentally weak character. And powerful Ranger decks are the exception, not the rule. The point is if the game is good, you won't have to search on the internet for extreme setups.

review: I love this game. The music and voice acting are phenomenal. The gameplay is a cross between little red riding hood and slay the spire. I gladly paid the 5.99 to unlock all of the classes. star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

review: Incredibly fun, rogue-like deck-builder with a LOT of replay value. Simple rules with decently complex gameplay mechanics. Worth the extra couple bucks for the add-ons like a new play mode and extra classes. One of very few mobile games I've actually wanted to get all the achievements for. Only issue is some localization/English translation weirdness from time to time, but pretty forgivable. If you like this one, check out Pathfinder Adventures too (based on the board game).
star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

review: A lovely deck-building game. Combat is intuitive and you can take your time to read the text of played cards. As a free to play you get one class to play in normal mode or in seven increasingly difficult modes (so there is some good replay value). Extra cards unlock as you progress through the game and purchases are never pushed. Ads are optional and can only be watched after beating a boss (to give you some extra gold). would definitely recommend for fans of this style of game.

For anyone looking for a card game this is pretty great.

star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

review: This is probably the first time I do not regret downloading a mobile game and for that reason I decided to write a review. You can tell that the developpers put alot of work and passion into this one. This is a mix between a roguelike RPG and a Card game (think Slay the Spire). The RNG makes each run feel fresh. One thing I enjoy is that if you die, you do not restart from the begining, the run ends when you simply cannot defeat an enemy with your current cards and decides to start over. The difficulty is well balanced. It might be hard at first but it will get easier as you'll learn the mechanics. The classes are all different and fun to play in their own way (and only a dollar each). There's alot of achievements and cards to unlock. I've just completed a run for the first time and I just hope that the developpers will keep adding to this amazing game

review: Okay! Here we go! I really enjoy the artwork, I'm a huge fan of dark and creepy/Tim Burtonesque whimsy...The whole style and playability of the game is fantastic. I also love the fairytale storyline. The game is challenging, fun and keeps my attention which many game apps do not. I also like the option to choose outcomes of a story after defeating a level, some things I choose are good, others are not...It creates a level of luck which is always fun in my opinion. However, just some ideas: put the book of cards deck on the main screen. I had to dig around quite a bit to eventually find it under achievements and then in the inconspicuous "i" symbol in the top left corner. Also, maybe just a general instructions manual? I only downloaded this yesterday but I still do not fully understand what all the cube symbols are under myself, what the sand timer means, what mana represents, etc. At times the game is difficult to follow. A question I have also is this, when I play a non basic card in a round, is it gone forever or can it be played multiple times later on? Or only if I bought it rather than being gifted it? Because there are some cards I'd like to hold on to to use against higher levels later on, but I'm afraid that once I use it, it will be out of my deck forever. Also, not sure if you're using a translator or not, but not all the cards make sense grammatically. Just my two cents! Overall, really beautiful game and I love being given the opportunity to check it out while it was free in the app store! Two thumbs up! :)

review: I really like the concept of playing as Little Red Riding Hood and having it's own unique lore to it as well. The game seems simple but that's not the case as you find new enemies that have their own strategy that can counter yours. The card system is very simple but is fun to play especially when you reach the end of every game you play. From its battles to its deep and amazing story of the Forest, this game is what I myself would call a masterpiece. I really recommend this game to those who like card strategy and unique story. Although be aware the story isn't really revealed until you reach the end (depending on certain circumstances).

review: This is without a doubt one of the best card games out there. it's absolutely amazing. The artwork is fenomenal. The music creates immersive atmosphere. The story is indulging. the enemies varied and you need to adjust your strategy to them. Bosses are challenging (especially on harder levels) and you really need to know the game to beat them. Every expansion or new content is well thought through. the only minor issue is translation as it is sometimes misleading. Awesome job guys keep it up.

review: Four stars because of needed improvements, five for overall fun level and quality of the game. To the reviewer who said Night of the Full Moon is easy if you know what you're doing, I say then provide some instruction so I can know what Im doing. The game is very difficult while youre trying to get a handle on how to play it. Just for one of many possible examples, it's not entirely clear what an "intersection" is in game terms. I can make a wild guess that it's a junction point of some sort, but beyond that, I have no real clue. Yet I am offered the choice to "go to the next intersection" quite often in the game. The upshot is that Im always unsure whether to choose it, because I dont know if I'll be calling down harder enemies upon my head, prematurely shortening the game, or what else/other. I simply dont know all of the effects of many of my choices in this game, and that takes some of the strategy--and hence, the joy that comes from successfully strategizing--out of the experience. Beyond that, though, I dont have much to complain about. I happen to like the fact that the characters' text and voiceovers are slightly different. Nothing is added or removed between them, the same thing is just said in a slightly different way. However, some other stuff, like character descriptions, intro text, or even the game description here on Google Play, could definitely benefit from a native English speaker's attention. Anyway, this is a really good game at core and well worth anyone's time.

I play this game. Sitting in an online Zoom class while the teacher has a one-on-one with another student? I play this game. I don't have enough room in this text box, but the game is very open, and they're always new ways to play and new cards to add. The developers did awesome on this one! 18/10, I recommend!

review: I liked this game, however this new update felt like there was a huge increase in difficulty. On hard mode the enemies all show up at once and there just isn't enough healing. Not to mention the enemies seem to have extreme increased health AND high draw power, the game now seems incompletable. And what happens after you die? You are given the chance to "resurrect" with a small buff of your choice... but not before having to watch an ad first. If you don't watch the ad you can still "resurrect" without watching but no buff is given. The devs DELIBERATELY made it harder so you have to watch an ad and give them free money in order to get anywhere in the game. I used to be able to clear the second chapter easily but now the game is impossible without external help. Cheapshot by the devs. I would give it 1 star for ruining the game but the game is fun, just not very fun when you keep losing due to lack of healing options and 8 straight enemies in a row. If they were smart enough they would allow us to watch a certain anount of ads in order to unlock characters. But i guess they weren't so pretty much the game is ruined. GG NO RE. Dead game. Move on to another game.

Just one question... Is it a bug or you can't beat the wizard with a nun? God knows I tried it a lot... He keeps turning into a statue and it's a never ending round because I can't kill him in one turn. He also removes poison when he turns into a statue so I can't stack it to 100. I find mistery man way easier than the wizard, and it should be the other way around. I am amazed I haven't broken the game because I went 600+ in armor before I gave up.

review: Well, the game is pretty good. No tutorial or explanations given about how to progress throughout the game, but you get the hang of it quickly. review: Almost the entire game is locked behind a pay wall, but they've been adding plenty of content even for f2p players. It's a very easy game compared to its obvious 'inspiration', Slay the Spire, but it does have harder difficulties later on and challenges to face. It's not amazingly well balanced but it's better than almost every other mobile game out there. I wasn't going to change my prior middling review, but one day I noticed that a second class had been unlocked via play! Would recommend!

review: I initially criticized the game for poor documentation but the wiki does have some good info, though not to the detail I would like. Maybe I have to join the forum. After playing it some more, I find it very addictive. Because the boards are quite short, the ending of the chapter or the game is just around the corner which keeps me motivated. I love that is it not a true rogue game and you do not have to start over if you die. Simply watch a 30 second add, get a blessing to help you become stronger and return to the screen where you chose the opponent. Perhaps you could get stuck and have to start over, but most of time you eventually win. There is such a large variety of cards and monsters to keep things interesting. Sometimes you can't get the ideal cards and have to strategize what cards will help you beat tough bosses when your cards are not what you would like. Lady knight is free but there are 4 bosses to beat at normal and 8 levels on hard difficuly, so one could be playing for a long, long time. Even though, I am playng the same character, after 6 plays and probably 15 hours, it is still fresh, The main problem is once you start playing you don't want to put it down until it's finish, which is bad for sleep.

review: I love the concept, and I love the execution. Lots of variety, and very fun. It can be a little frustrating when your character lacks certain critical cards and thus simply can't reach the upper limit of strength, but it does add replay value.  That being said, perhaps its because I'm using an old Galaxy S3, but the UI has some critical game breaking errors. This usually happens when there are "too many cards" to select from. Which can occur when... You are discarding from more than 6 cards, selecting a card (perhaps via "prophecy"), or even selecting a card to imbue (perhaps for Zeal). I've had a number of characters simply abandoned on the last level just because I couldn't actually progress anymore since the UI would give out.   Hopefully it works better on newer devices.

review: Probably the best mobile game I've played hands down. The amount that is free is great, and the amount you get out of the $5 dlc is enormous. I highly recommend spending the 5 bucks if you've got it. I just finished everything and have 90+ hours into the game. There's a LOT of content, ads are completely optional and always reward you with bonuses, and there's no microtransactions. There's a few bugs, which is to be expected with such a large game, but definitely VERY worthwhile!!

I'm that fool that has bought every bit of dlc, but even the free version gives you a lot too sick your teeth into.

It also helps that the characters aren't saying incredibly annoying/dumb stuff so again thank you for that.

review: A very fun card building, turn based battle game. While the execution of the gameplay is wonderful and the art and audio is amazing, the game seems to suffer from some balancing issues. It doesn't seem very fair if an enemy can kill me in one or two turns consistently when I'm at full health. The dialogue options also seem to appear randomly which can cause it to be difficult to gain the amount of courage or reputation you need. May be a very worthwhile game if some of the enemies can be balanced out.

review: It's like slay the spire light.  Very enjoyable, although I thought they made the knight super op (Blessing: Scorching Flame + Cheese Trap added with equip Bizarre Runes and Bear traps and the enemy kills themselves in no time). Bought the dlc and trying out all the different classes. They put in effort to make each class feel pretty distinct. Takes a little bit of getting used to and what kind of cards you want to go for, but not that hard to figure out after the first chapter.  Only thing that really bothers me is the typos. "Maximun health" is the biggest offender since you see it all the time.  Would love to see an endless version and some more to do with the skill tree (if you can even call it that). It's very barebones and you can fill it out in like 2 playthroughs. I thought there would be a skill tree per class, but there isn't. Would love to see something like that implemented in the future.   It's a fun game that you can pick up and leave with some elements of strategy.

review: A Fun, arcadey, card roguelike. I've been everything, unlocked all achievements and still go back to replay constantly. It's a game that is well tailored to mobile gaming. I wish there were more like it. While there are other roguelike card games, this one is a bit more arcade like, in that it builds up quickly, each class is widely different, and you are not limited to very low energy amounts. review: TL;dr: game is fine with the only free character, but it has a lot of big design flaws. Best free game on mobile, but still a pile of sh. Go play "Slay the Spire" instead. Speaking of "Slay the Spire", one thing developers of it understand is the rule of defense. In order to play such game you need defensive cards in addition to offensive ones. This is not the case for "Night of the Full Moon". Defensive cards are hard to come by, they don't do their job very well and half of the time you can't even play them. Why wouldn't you be able to play them you may ask? Simple! The enemies are broken. It is felt the most with bosses. You can't use actions against them. You can't use items against them. And the attacks won't save you from all the damage they deal. Still, this is the best free game on mobile that is not a puzzle. Just don't fight the final bosses.

review: Overall this is a really good game and much of it seems fair and balanced. The graphics, sound, and the gameplay are smooth but...what do you do when you're faced with an enemy directly counter to you? The witch in particular and the elf queen seem to hard-counter the base class you're given to play. I'm particular the witch has a card that, when used, will always return to get hand and you cannot mitigate its damage and she possesses an item to return her to life on death that she can use over and over. Maybe I'm bad at dealing with the caster enemies but it seems a bit unfair to let an enemy resurrect ad-infinitum of you're unlucky enough to not have equipment destruction immediately available.

review: I love this genre of game but they always seem to be unbalanced. As soon as you collect a few action cards that let you draw more cards you become practically invincible. There's an easy fix for this: Only allow action cards to draw more cards. This way players can still use that play strategy without it being super over powered because they're limited by their action points each turn. The translation is horrible (especially the voice overs) which sucks cause the game has a lot of story elements

review: The game is amazing! Gameplay is simple but intuitive, story is worthwhile and enjoyable. Even the characters are super quirky and fun. The only problem is the paywall. Sure you can go for a countless number of playthroughs as one or two characters but that's about it. Not for f2p players, but for those who are willing to pay for extra content, I'd very much recommend it! The game is still an amazing card game, but again, not everyone will want to pay a couple bucks.

review: Отличный рогалик, совмещенный с коллекционной карточной игрой. Пять полноценных классов (один бесплатный, остальные по доллару) стиль игры которых кардинально отличается, четыре концовки и много веселья. Отдельно хочу выделить звуковое сопровождение - оно просто восхитительное. Музыка, звуки, голоса - всё на высоте. Давно я не встречал настолько затягивающей одиночной игры на мобильные устройства. Одна из немногих игр, на которую я не пожалел денег.   Excellent rouglike card collecting game/ The closest relative IMO is Slay the Spire (although this game is inspired by some other game). I really like the game. 5 different classes (1 free and others are $1 each), 4 endings and lots of fun and challenge. And the game sounds nicely! Music, sounds, voices -the atmosphere is FANTASTIC! No regrets buying the game. Looking forward to new products! Keep it up!
star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

review: It's essentially a good game, BUT (and please read on) the total lack of intuitive explanation, particularly in reference to Exiling (Amnesia Taverns for example - Does it exile your card permanently, or just for that fight/combat) along with the lack of obvious and accessible instruction makes the game really frustrating. I wouldn't mind it there were good instructions elsewhere, with well compiled explanations, but there isn't anything that I could find for particular issues I experienced. It's a big let down because it's quite important if you are going to succeed in the later levels. Good game, poor player support.

review: The ads are never shoved in front of you, and the IAPs are non-essential bonus content and extremely fairly priced. The art is charming, and the voice acting is campy but endearing. NotFM is one of the few games that runs fullscreen with my phone's bezels, which I appreciate greatly. The game mechanics are a little easy to abuse (never feeling broken) and not as deep as I'd like, but I'm still having fun. There is clearly passion behind this game, and a fair bit of talent to back it up.

review: The only card game I have ever enjoyed for what it is. I keep coming back to this game to play 'just one more round'. A match lasts about 30 minutes, you can always try out new strategies, there is a big amount of cards and achievements to unlock. Buying the character pack has also been worth it. You get entirely different cards. Taking your time, min-maxing and finding a strategy to become powerful enough to defeat the last boss in one turn is part of the main routine. Fantastic game, period.

review: This game is extremely good. Catchy deckbuilding, resource management, and foes with just enough mixup to keep you on your toes. Big ups to the devs, I'll be looking forward to more updates and future games.

review: If you're like me, you sift through the massive garbage pile of games on the play store, hoping to find a game that's worth playing for more than twenty minutes. A solid deckbuilder, gorgeous art, fair pricing for extra content, optional ads that you don't feel the need to use, and enough unlockable content to make each run feel new. Minor downsides: slightly poor translation, some esoteric mechanics, and a bit easy if you're competent.

review: Very well designed. Financially speaking, it uses the best model. No ads, no cash-in upfront, no pay2win. The game lets you play as many walkthrough as you want with the first class, then you can choose to buy the whole classes bundle or the classes separatively if you want to try it a bit more. Speaking about the game itself, it's very fun and rewarding. It emphasizes on both long term and short term strategies, and the gameplay just get you hooked. Cant comment longer. Thanks for the game.
star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

review: Amazing. This is an amazing game and i cant reccomend it enough. It's a card based game but changes the more you play and has a great storyline to it. The only reason i rate 4/5 stars instead of 5/5 is that I wish there was a bit more length, or that they could extend the story somehow. I love how it's set up now but it's just not very difficult to play through the entire game if you have some free time. Other than this though it's an amazing game and I think you should at least try it out. :)

review: Definitely my all-time favorite! I think someone should revise the English translation and some extra instructions for beginners would be nice. It's impossible to explain the game to friends... The game itself is really great and there are a lot of ways to play, I unlocked everything in the game because I couldn't get enough of it! The art is amazing and the whole game is amazingly well-balanced! (Some monsters are tougher than others though) Highly recommend this! Read carefully in game!

review: Over the years I've 100% this game's achievements because I love it so much. There's many playstyles you can try for a single class. The ads as a free player are non-intrusive and you will WANT to get the DLC if you enjoy the game. They've even introduced a new mode called "Diaries" with different cards and features for even more hours of playtime! I was hooked from the first time playing and even after 2+ years of playing, I still love it. Give this game a try, you won't be disappointed.

review: One if the first good mobile interpretations of the STS deck building roguelike I've played. Thr innovations that have made don't detract (much) from the strategic depth, while allowing for the gameplay to be optimized for mobile play. That being said, it's just not that hard? I've gotten into the flow, and gave no won 10 consecutive times, going from Hard 1-7 on one class, and hard 1-4 in another. It is fun though, just don't expect the same longevity as slay the spire (and friends)

review: Would absolutely be a five star game, but you cannot unlock new characters, modes, adventures or literally anything without making a cash purchase. review: A card game where you actually feel the feeling of progression both with the achievement and rewards and with the knowledge of which card to choose. Still i wonder if the developer realized he called two different cards "double strike" (and one of them is in my opinion the second best card in the game after bolster). The luck component is fun and the game itself eliminates the deck building part of other cards games that required me hours and ultimately made me abandon those games out of boredom

review: To make a review brief: this game is fantastic. The cardplay is fun, the game has a lot of polish for a free chapter and there arent any ads to disrupt gameplay, which was a nice touch. A typical run of the game can last an hour or 2 at least, but you can pick it up where you left off, and it really demands repeat playthroughs. I can't recommend this game enough. The only downside is that you have to buy the other characters, but considering the polish anf the lack or ads, its very well worth it

review: This game is great, mechanically. Not as in-depth (free class) as some pc alternatives, but fun for a mobile game. But it seems that there are missing some QA work, speech bubbles not matching the voice lines, formatting that's weird etc. I'll probs buy the full game when I complete the free class, but I wish there was a trial of the other classes, just let me play against one 30 card deck with achievements disabled or something so I can get a feel for them before I buy.

review: I loved the game, had some minor issues with bosses and the headless horseman, but I love a challenge. There is one small issue though, when you go over to the ranger page you will see "Unlock Now" and an arrow on its left that reads "Trail" instead of Trial. It's not much an issue just something I noticed and thought it was funny. I love the characters, the cards, the animation, the story all of it. It's a great game and I highly recommend.

review: The Good: Certain classes are fun to play and easy to figure out what fits best. Being able to stack damage to kill and enemy in one shot because of your amazing strategy is a good feeling to have. The Bad: One issue is percentages in the game, for example - recently I was trying the ranger and had the perfect set up for a Dodge build. I had 2 Dex talismans, a Game Cloak, Fast reactions and 2 dodges. I had a good draw and got 125% chance to dodge. The very first card hit me and killed me. Bug?

review: Enjoyable, well put-together, bought the collectors edition. Only complaint is its very easy to get backed in to a corner. Much success is based on luck as well as skill on higher difficulties, with injuries carrying over between fights, and finding yourself low on health against a tough enemy when you are out of healing options can put up a permanent road block, wasting your progress and sucking the fun out of the game. If they added full health to the ad revive it'd be a 5 star game.

review: I really like this game and it's easy to get your head around compared to other card games. The art style is wonderful and the voice acting is great! However, the cards you get are all governed by chance and if you constantly get bad hands...you're kinda screwed, especially as there's no literal way to go back and "hoard cards" (as your tips after death always say). The mapping of chapters is also confusing and there hasn't really been given a reason why after a time they jump you forward in the story.

review: Fun deck-building strategy game. The base game has enough content to keep you entertained. The in-app purchases are expansions that add additional story characters and deck building strategies. My biggest complaint is that the translation to English is weak in some areas and can be confusing to what power-ups and cards actually do. There's still a couple of power-ups that I am unsure as to what they do and don't consider them in my strategy. If translation were improved I'd rate 5 stars.

review: The game is cool, but final bosses (Werewolf, Priest) take too long to kill. I'm not saying they are hard to kill, or require you to spend money to win, or require a lot of luck. No, the problem is they have unlimited recurring turns with immunity or recurring health buffs, so you have to whittle them down over and over & then hope to finish them off before they get their health back. I spent 15 MINUTES killing the damn werewolf. This game mechanic makes the whole thing tedious.

review: Excellent game. Every enemy is unique, it's exhilarating to create high damage combos, the backstory is well-written, and the art and voice acting are great and fit the atmosphere. Biggest negative is how the harder difficulties can be a little too reliant on luck, especially when healing becomes less efficient. Also, this game takes up a ton of space, so make sure you have some to spare before downloading.

review: A beautiful gem of a game if you want a well-polished solo deck builder with beautiful handdrawn art with ethical IAP modeling. Iap is dlc & not required to play, there's a collectors edition to unlock all the classes plus various perks & a separate purchase option for each class individually if you don't want the bundle. The other IAP's are for 1 DLC expansion gameplaly mode & an unrelated jigsaw mini game. So if you're on the fence because of the iap complaints, hopefully you'll read this.

review: One of the best mobile games I've played. Variety of "professions" allows for many interesting ways to play, each character feels unique both in gameplay and aesthetics. Randomization of each playthrough makes it incredibly replayable. Rare case of ethical monetization - try one class for free, one-time pay for more + optional non-intrusive adds for small buffs. Story is interesting and patching it from various monsters lore feels a bit like detective job. Highly recommend

star: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

review: I really like the game, but there are a couple things that really really frustrated me. 1. The game has no tutorial 2. When showing what cards the enemies played, they flash by so fast I cant read them, so I dont know what the enemy is doing. 3. The written dialogue and spoken dialogue dont match, and often have very different meanings. 4. The player cant heal themselves when they desperately need to. I felt the bandage cards only came up when I was high on hp, none of the stores or the chests allow for things like potions, and it's very random whether you'll get a healing ability in game or not. This leads to me dying over and over because not only do I not get how to play the game, but I have to go into battles with 8 hp or something, when the enemy has 50, and eventually at that point I felt like no matter what I did I had to restart. If the game improved on these things I think I'd play it alot more.

review: This is a really fun game, and I had many hours of enjoyment out of it. However, I think the knight class needs to be reworked. It is shown as the easiest class, but I couldn't win a single game as the knight. I unlocked the ranger, which was a higher difficulty, and won every game I played. Other than that, it's a good game and I highly recommend it. Edit: after the Oct 18th update, it feels like the classes are better balanced. Knight is now the easiest and ranger is more difficult. I have paid

review: Firstly, I have only played the first character (knight). I've only beaten 7 times and I'm still playing. The plot and artwork is good. However, there is a bit to be desired from gameplay. Card synergies aren't obvious and aren't abundant (with the knight), hopefully more cards relying on synergies will be introduced, such as Slay the Spire combinations. Some enemies are way too OP. They have cards that do massive damage. One enemy even copies your whole deck. I look forward to your changes!

review: This game might not be for everyone, but if you know of Slay the Spire and like it - its for you. One of the few games that I really love. Replayable and actually takes skill, with a nice progression system to change up the gameplay over time. A few time quality of life improvements that I'd like: - Better UI for the Courage and Reputation counters. Isn't super clear. - Have a separate 'New Game' and 'Load' buttons. I find myself resetting runs because I forget how the save mechanic works. Otherwise, great game. The developers responded quickly to an issue I have before, and it now works. 10/10

review: This is easily my favorite mobile game. It's fun, looks amazing, and has subjectively fantastic voice acting. Ads are unobtrusive and optional, and it is fully offline outside of initialization to access cloud saves. The gameplay is reminiscent of Slay the Spire as a deck-builder, but this game has far more classes and is arguably easier because of a lack of energy. That is my only complaint: the game allows invincible runs for skilled players, reducing replayability. Still, I love this game.

review: It's a decent game. The graphics and gameplay are both stellar. My only issue is that once you beat the first phase, they have you play each level 7 times over with increasing difficulty. I did my best to beat the game without using revives/ads but realized its impossible. It feels like they made it really difficult in order to force people to watch ads. For example, there are some characters that can consistently kill you in a single turn from full health, and thus forces you to use revives.

review: I've played this game almost every day for the last two weeks and I can tell you it's got a TON of replay value in it. There are a bunch of classes, my favorite is the Mechanic, each with different build paths and deck mechanics you can mess around with. Honestly this has been my favorite game that I have had on any phone and I would highly recommend it to anyone who likes either card games, RPGs, strategy, turn based, or just games in general. The only thing it lacks is an infinite mode. 10/10

review: Absolute outstanding game. I love it. If i could rate it 10 stars I'd give it 11. I had to restart the story 3 times because i would dig myself into a spot that was impossible to get out of, I'd have 4 or 5 health with no way to increase health and start fighting a boss enemy. But i was actually happy to restart because i was able to mold my character and deck in a new and exciting way! I'm not sure how you actually made it a pleasure to restart my progress so many times, but i can't wait to play the next release of content, until then ill keep replaying what I've already beat.

Only having one class at first and having to buy every single other one feels a bit limiting but isn't terrible.

review: Why is the plot of this game so filled with shallow and blatant anti-Catholic propaganda? I would understand if it were thought-provoking, but it really isn't. It's the same old tropes in humorously boring fashion. That being said, the game itself is actually amazing. The art is beautiful. The gameplay is amazing (at least until this last update which seemed to make it way easier). It is a very good game, which makes it all the more a shame that the plot has such shallow anti-Catholicism.

review: Good game. I don't like that you need to be online to access the classes even after you purchase them which is to say. This is one of the few games that I do recomend purchasing the additional content for IF you play this a lot. That said it's a good time kill game. The fact that I can call something on mobile a game is impressive once again. I look forward to more from this developer and ideally they can fix the problem with the classes being locked unless your online. 4 out of 5. It does not have a lot of replay value after you finish the knight but like I said, the classes change that and being locked makes that a slight problem. People who have enough money to spend on excess data won't have a major problem with this. Over all I do enjoy the game for what it's worth and it is worth full price. If there is anything worth noting at all for the developer directly. This game drains battery like a beast. If it's possible to fix that, that would be great but I think that might just be a by product of the animation, size, and engine.

review: It's a fun game and has a good feel, I really enjoy the music. However, it is linear in all the wrong ways. When I got to a difficult boss, there was no way to back track. I tried a Dark Souls number of times but my deck and character just couldn't beat the boss of the first chapter. So while it wasn't a huge time sink to get there, no more than two hours, it still meant I had to start from the beginning and hope that this time around I could defeat the boss. Very frustrating. Beyond that the voices for the characters are fun, and I like that they have two or three lines they say to keep things interesting. If they had a store or back button option it would definitely be a 5 star for me.

review: This game is a fun little card building game. I can't recommend it enough. There seem to be new monsters popping up occasional and the extra classes play so differently I want to try them all. I always avoid spending money on phone games because they are just grindy with no actual game play but this one is different. I bought a character and may buy others because they play differently and the game has replay value and challenge. Great game, thanks for making it. I'm enjoying it.

review: This is a truly excellent game that I wish I could give five stars. The artwork and animation are great, the gameplay is fun, and the pricing for unlocks is fair. The localization is pretty shoddy, but that's a nitpick. The biggest problem here is that there is no purchase option to disable ads. I'd much rather hand over $5 or $10 to permanently get double coin rewards on bosses and have a set amount of revives per run, rather than consistently be asked to watch an ad.
star: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

review: Engaging, challenging, and LOTS of diverse attacks. I purchased the Collector's Edition & Red Hood expansion, and they provide SO much content. No more than $10, it's a great deal, unlike some games that are pay-to-win or force you to rely on ads. The only "flaw" is there isn't a lot of story, but the hours of gameplay more than offset that. We need more devs like this, that offer great games and aren't greedy. Even one purchase helps them stay in business. So support them and enjoy the game :)

review: The game is amazing on the art and gameplay is very smooth (the occasional crash here and there) The story is pretty cool, specially if you're into the Grimm stories. The card are beautiful and the combos that can be pulled out from them are awesome. My only concern is with the Nun Deck.... the unbalance is RIDICULOUS, I have lost with this deck more than with ALL the others COMBINED. You could be fighting against a foe and they will kill you with 2 cards easily while you wait for a stupid Prayer

review: This game is very enjoyable coming from playing many hours of Slay the Spire. Gameplay is fun, lots of cool mechanics, characters and voice-acting are well done, and the story segments are a very interesting twist on Little Red Riding Hood. My only gripe with the game is that it is full of typos and grammatical errors. "Maximun" health, Perist instead of Priest, etc. Also, the speech bubbles do not always match up with the voice acting. If these things get fixed the game will be 5/5.

review: Very fun and easy to play. Not always easy to win. The game is animated simply, but beautifully. The voice acting and sound effects are very nice. There is enough gameplay variety to be interesting, without being overwelming. This game strikes a great balance of being easy to play, but hard to beat. Certain bosses are cake. review: Spectacular game - I don't usually write reviews for games, but I have got to make exceptions at times like this when I am delightfully surprised. This game exceeded my expectation in so many ways. The way the game is designed, each run will almost never be the same due to the element of RNG in Blessings (Passive) & Cards (in Shops) & the sequence the enemy appears. Unlocking the blessings through the run throughs in different difficulties give you a sense of achievement. Base game (free) - a bit restrictive as there are only 2 available classes, "Knight" being the base class and "Magician" as an unlockable. Add-ons - this game allow you to gain access to additional content for a ONE time fee, unlike most games nowadays, monthly recurring fees are always daunting and annoying. In this game however, you can buy additional content such as: 1) Expansion pack with extra heroes (Nun, Ranger, Witch, Werewolf, Apothecary) 2) New game mode "Diary" 3) Additional Bonuses (Piggy Bank) 4) No Advertisement (Worth in terms of time) 5) "Soul Hunter" Class 6) "Mechanic" Class Each item listed above requires individual transaction but overall is pretty affordable and in my opinion worth the money you are paying for. May I also add, all the different classes are quite different on their own and have a different play style and I have no clue how they make it so different in each of the classes and make them all so fun to play through. Other good thing about this game is that it is completely offline, meaning you can play it literally anywhere - on flight (not that you can fly nowadays), in elevator, down in the dungeon, you get the drift. The graphic & music is also top-notched. I have always been a sucker for card games/deck-building games, and have tried dozens of card games from Yugioh, Hearthstone, Gwent, etc. Those games are fun but this Deck-building game is completely different in its style, combining with dungeon crawling & opportunity cost of items selection and resource allocation. We all need some diversity at times to keep things spicy and I think this game will do for others. I don't write a lot of reviews, but I hope I give you guys my perspective of how much I have enjoyed playing this game. I wish there are more future contents for this game in terms of classes and story modes, this game definitely left me wanting more!! Thanks for the developer for making such an incredible game and I am glad I found this during the COVID lockdown period where my holiday is ruined, but this game kind of make it at least a fun Christmas!

review: This game is extremely fun, I cant stop playing it. No other rogue like deck builder type game even compares to this one. The smoothness and variety and graphics are above par. The achievements section is awesome as well gives you something to shoot for each play through. Would love to see new chapters, longer chapters. A new game plus mode would be fun where enemies scale up with you but you keep your deck. Or perhaps an endless mode where you see how far you can make it with leaderboards. Keep up the good work and please keep the content coming, I dont want the game to get abandoned.

review: A very very great card game. Simple but fun with a large time sink if you allow it. You enter the forest and kill everything you meet, the cards and simple. Equipment has passive bonuses which active. Spells cost mana, actions are buffs with their own currency to use. It's very simple. You can spend hours playing this, 4 easy bosses per each run and 5 hard mode with mini bosses sprinkled between. You build your deck how you want with never feeling too weak. All ads are optional too.

review: My only complaint about the game is how short the runs are. Though it is more then made up for in how diverse and different the runs can be which is Fantastic! I love the art style, the game is smooth and fluid and the voice acting brilliant! The game play is challenging though simplistic as well which really ropes you in as you build and find your "unbeatable" deck. I would like more story and length to the runs as said, but I plan fully on beating every boss on normal and hard difficulty and will be buying the different classes shortly after. All in all, fair play Giant Network, fair play *Begins to clap in praise* Keep up the great work cause it certainly shows
