review: I loved the game, the mechanics work perfectly and if you make the right choices you can watch as your deck becomes better and better, and that's where I think the game misses a step. I think you should make a much longer campaign, because once I'm finished with it, I'm not really that interested in playing it again, even with a different class, if I don't see the possibility of developing a deck to its maximum possibilities. Playing the game again would be a chance to develop a new one aiming to a different style of combat, for example, but that can not happen in the state the game is in right now. Another important feature I would love would be a kind of arena where you can battle monsters (or other people, although maybe that would become troublesome to handle with all servers and stuff, it's kind of hard to do if your game wasn't developed to be an online game from the start) with the old decks you created in your older campaigns (maybe put a choice whether to save it or not for the arena after you've finished you adventure). Or -and this I think would be the best choice that could make your game one of the best I've ever played on my phone- you could update the campaign periodically, letting the user choose among one of their old decks to play the new chapter, adding new pieces to the story and buiding up the difficulty, up to a point where the principal motif of the game would become building the perfect deck, after you've uncovered the whole mistery of the story. Okay if you add all of that I'm definitely going to pay for this game and give it five stars.

star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

review: This is one of the best games I've played on mobile and the first one I decided to spend money on. Before you let that scare you away, hear me out. There are no ads, even if you pay nothing. The only benefit paying unlocks is more "classes," but this is in no way mandatory. It's really just more content. In fact, some of the classes you unlock seem to make the game a little harder. If you do decide to buy anything each class is $0.99 extra. If you want you can bundle them all, at least at the time of this writing, for $3. It's definitely worth the $3 if you like the starter class. As far as the game itself, the animation/graphics are good, there is no lag (at least on my Pixel XL), the sound is high quality, the assortment of choices for each class ensures replayability even for the single starter class (the bundle adds five or six more classes with different cards and abilities.. I can't remember exactly how many without opening the game). Tldr; worth your time.

review: This game is really fun even if you have to but the other characters you can still feel the intensity every run. The controls are really easy too, just drag and drop, how easy could that be. The graphics are sooooooo nice they're not realistic, exaggerated but simple. It doesn't rely on the graphics or how it's actually executed but it's more focused on the content. But there's still one little thing that I want to point out. When I went offline I couldn't use the characters that I bought and I was trying to finish that round. So devs, what I'm basically asking is to make the characters available to use for those people that bought it legally. But generally this is amazing. This game can go to different places. I mean it's just a suggestion but can you guys add a pre run shop or in game currency that can be used to buy cards so it's unlocked or even gave a shop where you can set up a run where you have all sorts of cards or something like that. But anyways good job DEVS! good work for making this game so fun and simple I will support this game and I'd like to leave this quote here- "Simplicity is beauty".

review: Very unique deck builder that puts an awesome twist on the Red Riding Hood story. There is DLC, but I don't feel it is overpriced, given what each pack gives you. Truly amazing game. Some of the translations are a bit off, but I feel like that adds some character. If you enjoy deck tweaking and figuring out interactions between cards, this one is a must play. I wouldn't recommend it for anyone under 12, sure to the complexity.

review: Nice game tbh. I love it. But it can get boring real quick. Some enemies have a buff to heal 20+ at every turn (such as the werewolf) and you have to choose to heal 40% of his health later on. Which can get very unfair tbh for the player. I realize it takes patience, but you have to realize it gives the werewolf an unfair advantage. I personally have tons of health, attack, and armor cards but even then after a 20 minute long battle I just don't want to play anymore because it's the same thing over and over again. In the end, the werewolf wins unless you have a twist of luck that allows you to kick his butt. I'm still going to play the game..but just not as much.

review: Fun but HP doesn't recover! The game is really fun. But there are 3 ways to recover HP : 1. Get the bandages card 2. The witch's apothecary 3. Level Up. There is no concept of time limit, where if you wait, your HP will recover. The result is that you're faced with bosses who obviously have an advantage over you and to top it off you have no means to recover your HP. Stuck in an endless loop. Because after each death, the HP doesn't recover!! Can't progress, have to restart the story!

review: A very enjoyable short and replayable card collector rogue lite. Very intriguing but short story based on your actions and other playthroughs. Every new playthrough is enhanced by cards you gain through achievements even if you don't finish your run. The multiple classes all play very differently yet seems to be well balanced and worth the cost of a couple of coffees. The pay off for some final bosses are definitely worth it especially if you have a keen eye for details. I highly recommend this game and am eagerly awaiting the next title released by these developers.

review: Generally well-designed and lots of replay value. The stories are rather queer, but the voicing really adds atmosphere to the game. It started off simple and easy to grasp, and got more challenging the more you played. There was different ways to play, if you wanted to do high amounts of damage, or have lots of health, and even more. There was even achievements, adding a side objective to highten the challenge. Defintely worth paying for the paid content, for a mobile game. I recommend this game.

review: Great-looking game, feels polished and solid. My main gripe is that without a limit to how much you can attack per turn, the game feels incredibly easy and strategy goes out the window in favor of unloading draw and attack cards. 7 of the 8 classes in the game are locked behind a pay wall, but I had no motivation to buy them because the free class offers little strategy or challenge. It's a shame because I think they had their heart in the right place, and they obviously put in a lot of effort

review: One of the best games i have played for mobile devices. This game gets a perfect score. Everything about it is great; from the art style to the mechanics. The different classes offer quality replay value with each different play style, the dialogue and RPG elements is engaging and rewarding, making for an immersive experience. I find myself unable to put it down. The game strikes an even balance between challenge and accessibility, and worth the few dollars to unlock the extra content. My only request or want is more chapters. Having a longer run as little red riding hood, or perhaps other fairytales to play through, like alice in wonderland or LRRH's adventure beyond the dark forest would be awesome. Really, i cant get enough of this game. How do you face 'The Father', though. Thats the last achievement, but i am dont think i have seen him once.

review: I don't usually play mobile games, but this was an exception. You play as Little Red Riding Hood and can choose from multiple classes, which will determine the theme of the cards that you can obtain. Each playthrough is different, and there are mechanics like the Courage/Reputation system that motivates you to go through the game again to find out what dialogue options provide which (since the mechanic is tied to which boss you can fight at the end). Normal has a nice difficulty for those who are more casual (like myself), and Hard is more suited for those who are interested in figuring out the optimal strategies in terms of deck makeup, which fights to skip, etc. The hand-drawn "rough" art style may not be for everyone, and it did bother me a little at first, but it's nothing alarming. I highly recommend this game.

review: The game is amazing. Graphics, music, story everything is perfect. I wanted to buy the premium bundle but there is one issue. I checked the reviews and I found someone complaining about the login. And it was true. The game doesn't retain the login state. Everytime you restart the game it logs you out. Sometimes it doesn't log you in in the first place. I've tried logging in using google play. Sometimes it work and sometimes it doesn't. But whenever it works, it logs you out after you restart.

review: I've only played the first chapter on normal, but I absolutely love it. The character design is unique, and opponents typically have their own unique "decks" to use against you. I have two concerns though: first is the unlocking of each boss. The witch is automatic; to get the werewolf, you need to have a lot of courage, and the priest requires you to do those two bosses first. Some opponents give you an opportunity to "interact" with them, which can ultimately affect which boss you get, but the rewards for the answers are miniscule, I find myself a point shy of getting yhe werewolf because RNG wasn't on my side, and I didn't have the opportunity to gain more reputation/courage. Second, is the characters themselves. Although I praised their design, some of them have ridiculous abilities that make defeating then a lot harder. The Pig Widow and Ghost Dolls are such an example -- I lose a turn, or I can't deal any damage in a turn. It gets annoying after a bit, especially when you're doing it for the EXP or gold, and would rather anything else... It grows tedious fighting them after a while, which is kind of disappointing to me. Criticisms aside, I found it to be a lot of fun, and I'd highly recommend it if you want a game to pass the time with. I spent literal hours playing this without realising, it's different, and fun (although it can be a little tricky in the beginning).

review: I was immediately immersed in this and liked the mechanics to unlock the different bosses. The animations and design elements are excellent, too. After a few run throughs things get repetitive and you easily find the systems that work, so buying the expansions keep the game interesting. It'd be nice if the story was longer and you had more diverse enemies, though. There are translation issues, and things aren't exactly clear for how to begin, but you catch on quickly.

review: It is a well crafted and quite enjoyable game! Nice graphics, good sould, and clear controls. There is one serious issue though: the balance. The default difficulty and all intermediate difficulties are super easy! To unlock the final difficulty, you need to repeatedly beat the game 9-10(!) times; and even then, only few last enemies are challenging... Still 5 stars though. TO THE DEVS: consider adding "exiled" attribute to all equipment cards, otherwise they are too easy to exploit.
